meanings.definition: Relating to or resembling an apse.
meanings.sent1: The church had a beautiful apsidal design.
meanings.sent2: The apsidal shape of the building added elegance to its architecture.
meanings.sent3: The apsidal windows looked like welcoming arms, embracing the sunlight.
meanings.sent4: Her smile had an apsidal quality, drawing everyone's attention.
meanings.sent5: The apsidal curve of the hill made it a perfect spot for stargazing.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the apsides of an orbit.
meanings.sent1: The satellite's apsidal motion was carefully calculated by the scientists.
meanings.sent2: The apsidal points of the planet's orbit determined its closest and farthest distances from the sun.
meanings.sent3: The apsidal dance of the planets around the sun fascinated astronomers.
meanings.sent4: The apsidal rhythm of the moon's orbit influenced the tides on Earth.
meanings.sent5: The apsidal alignment of the planets created a celestial harmony in the night sky.
